## AOSI vs ADOS

The comparison between AOSI (Autism Observation Scale for Infants) and ADOS (Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule) is crucial for psychologists and researchers in the field of autism studies. Both these tools are designed to evaluate behavior that may suggest the presence of autism.

## Compare the items in AOSI and ADOS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import AOSI and ADOS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just AOSI into Harmony</a> - compare AOSI with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just ADOS into Harmony</a> - compare ADOS with other instruments


Harmony, with its state-of-the-art technology and AI capabilities, can help you harmonise and compare AOSI and ADOS. Harmony not only compares the items in AOSI and ADOS, but it also provides a percentage match between each item. This feature can greatly save time and increase the efficiency of clinical psychologists and researchers.

The comparison between these two scales, AOSI and ADOS, is critical in understanding their functional differences and drawing robust conclusions from them. Therefore, if you are a researcher or psychologist dealing with AOSI and ADOS, it's highly suggested that you utilize Harmony. No more going through long PDFs manually! Just drag and drop your questionnaires, whether it's AOSI, ADOS, or any other questionnaires pertaining to autism studies, into Harmony's user-friendly interface.
